fields.question_text: In an MRI scan, which anatomical plane divides the body into left and right halves?
fields.explanation: The sagittal plane divides the body into left and right portions. The midsagittal plane specifically divides the body into equal left and right halves.

fields.question_text: What is the approximate Hounsfield Unit (HU) range for adipose tissue (fat) on CT scans?
fields.explanation: Adipose tissue typically measures between -190 and -30 HU on CT scans, with most fat measuring around -100 HU. This negative value reflects fat's lower density compared to water (0 HU).

fields.question_text: Which organ is located in the left upper quadrant of the abdomen and is responsible for filtering blood and immune functions?
fields.explanation: The spleen is located in the left upper quadrant, beneath the diaphragm and lateral to the stomach. It filters blood, removes old red blood cells, and plays a role in immune system function.

fields.title: Basic Anatomy Pre-Screening Test
fields.description: This test evaluates your foundational understanding of anatomical planes, imaging basics, and organ identification - essential skills for medical image annotation.
